properties.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas
properties.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 31 at 12:08PM PST until January 4 at 4:00AM PST by NWS San Diego CA
properties.description:
...A LONG PERIOD WEST-NORTHWEST SWELL FROM 290 DEGREES WILL
GENERATE HIGH SURF WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY...

.Highest surf will be at WNW facing beaches in San Diego County
with elevated to locally high surf expected at Orange County
beaches.

The National Weather Service in San Diego has issued a High Surf
Advisory...which is in effect from 4 PM Wednesday to 4 AM PST
Saturday.

* Surf...For San Diego County, surf will be 7-9 ft. Local sets
to 10 ft possible, mainly in southern San Diego County. For
Orange County, surf will be 5-7 ft.

* Timing...Surf will build Wednesday night into Thursday, peaking
Thursday afternoon. Surf will begin to subside Friday night but
is expected to remain elevated through the weekend.

* Tides...High tide 3.9 ft at 3 PM Thursday and 4.1 ft at 4 PM
Friday.

* Impacts...Dangerous swimming conditions and a high risk of rip
currents. Local beach erosion is possible.
properties.instruction:
A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in
the advisory area...producing localized beach erosion and
dangerous swimming conditions.

NWSheadline: HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM WEDNESDAY TO 4 AM PST SATURDAY
